newsitem.title: UK: Cambridge Antibody Tech to raise 35 mln stg.
newsitem.headline: Cambridge Antibody Tech to raise 35 mln stg.

text.p: Britain's Cambridge Antibody Technology Group Plc would raise 35 million stg through a placement of new ordinary shares with institutional and other investors, sponsor of the issue, Kleinwort Benson said on Friday.
Cazenove & Co is acting as broker to the flotation.
Kleinwort said none of the existing shareholders would sell their holdings in the placement.
CAT specialises in a technology that has applications in the development of antibody-based human therapeutic products.
CAT, founded by David Chiswell in collaboration with the Medical Research Council, commenced operations in January 1990.
The group plans to develop a portfolio of clinical development programmes with the objective of launching three to four such programmes every year from 2000. -- London Newsroom +44 171 542 4366
